name: Motel Corsi

reviews.text: Near the airport..........why we chose it. Price should have given it away. It is a dump.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room smelled of smoke; mattress horrible; noisy street; do not go to this Hotel unless you have to.
reviews.title: generally great value.

reviews.text: The only good thing was the restaurant across the street was the most typical "Godfather" type restaurant I've ever been in. The food was great, but if it hadn't been, you would have been afraid to complain.
reviews.title: Picturesque hotel close to airport great price

likes.disliked: — noise near a train we could hear several times at night

reviews.title: Good value
reviews.text: We arrived at the Hotel at 7:30am,after leaving Carnivals Liberty in Cittavecchia Italy. we did not have a problem to get into our room at that hour ,and the sumtuious breakfast (American) was a bonus. This hotel is about 40 minutes from Romes Port and 15 minutes from Romes Flulmincino Airport,in a stright line onA12 the autostrada.(be prepaed for outrageous Taxi fare from the port to the hoel was 160Euros or 190.00 US. The next day we went to the aairport and the fare was 35 Euros. So the best bet is to find a bus from the port to the airport if u want to save money, The owner Mr Costi and his waitress in the restaurant were very helpfull in suggesting that for 12Euros each a bus and train ticket could be purchased for the day. We the spent our las tday in Rome very Inexpenseivlly.(NO TAXI) Also the room was a nice size and ver clean. Again thank u Mr Costi a verry nice ending to my 25 ays in Italy.

description: Welcome to Motel Corsi from 40 years Motel Corsi offers its services to those who reach Rome for a journey of pleasure or for work situated in Via Aurelia Km 27,700. Motel Corsi is in an ideal position where you can enjoy a holiday to the sea or the beauty of Rome. The hotel is only 15 minutes from St.Peter and from the international airport of Fiumicino "Leonardo da Vinci." It is near the beaches of Fregene and near the Etruscan fuins of Cerveteri.
